duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan, develop, document, and execute test and evaluation actions for complex mechanical, electro-mechanical, and electrical/electronic systems.
Forecast and request resources to support test and evaluation actions, including supporting ATEC in efficiently executing tests to MATDEV priorities.
Coordinate schedules and timeline requirements with APMs, PdMs, PM, and PEO to ensure test and evaluation actions are executed in accordance with program requirements.
Complete test documentation in support of milestone decisions and material release.

education_certification.credential: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or related technical disciplines. Four years of additional direct relevant technical experience or relevant military service may be substituted for education.
